page.title: 15ROADS MINCHINHAMPTON STROUD
page.content: {TOM LONG'S POST}is a sign post on Minchinhampton Common at a junction where many roads meet:from Stroud; Nailsworth;Amberley;Minchinhampton; Cirencester and Brimscombe.The site is said to be where some highwaymen committed suicide to avoid capture. All roads are unfenced causing danger for traffic from grazing and wandering beasts. {EARLY HIGHWAY}- the first evidence of a road is a report of a highway robbery in 1371.The road from Stroud to Cirencester was turnpiked in 1752 at Minchinhampton with a toll gate at the site of the present Blue Boys Dairy. The stage coaches used the road to travel to Cirencester and London but when the Stroud to Cirencester road (A 419) was built in the Brimscombe valley traffic grew much less.
